channel.title: E-Readers
channel.description:
I enjoy reading books, but reading them from a computer isn't that great and bad for my eyes. Buying books is an option, but most books I enjoy are free already (gutenberg project, google books, etc). So I think it's time to buy an e-reader. But because it's a new market, there are quite a few that support different formats, and have different features. I can be objective and just put every available e-reader in a list and compare, but I want experiences.
I think the Sony ones are quite good, but what are your opinions? Should I pick one with a touch screen, and live with the reflection, or without?

item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Mopman:

a guy i know who had a sony recently got a kindle and says its a lot better

Kindle’s biggest feature is probably the big amount of books you can buy directly via the Kindle. But most books sold by Amazon are English, and when I want to buy a book I’d rather have a Dutch book. I don’t need a Kindle for that, and it looks quite big. I don’t need a keyboard on it.

[quote=“Ollie, post:3, topic:329446”]http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/technology/2010/02/mirasol-color-e-reader-e-ink.html

wait.[/quote]

Looks interesting, but I guess the price will be quite high, and I don’t really need a colour screen, unless of course the price is competitive.

chri5:

I have an HTC Hero, and the PDF application on there is okay for me. I know it’s not good for my eyes, but then again I don’t do much reading unless it’s a programming reference book/uni shit, but then that’s all in books.

An LCD screen can suffice if you read a book now and then, but I want to replace paper for something digital.

Just an example: We have two subjects that are about law. Business law and Tax law. Both subjects require me to carry around a book that’s about 7cm thick. Luckily, I don’t have both subjects on the same day, otherwise the two books wouldn’t fit in my bag. Replacing those books with a device that’s about 1cm thick saves my back too.
